alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene; Southeast Greene; Washington (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:39PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Washington, southeastern Jefferson, Cocke, Greene and western Unicoi Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Jonesborough to 9 miles northeast of Parrottsville to 7 miles west of Newport. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greeneville, Newport, Erwin, Jonesborough, Tusculum, Parrottsville, Midway, Banner Hill, Mosheim and Caney Branch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene; Southeast Greene; Washington
